solution.text:
Given equations are :
x + _{j}_y = _{k}_ and _{i}_x - _{j}_y = _{l}_
Since coefficient of y is same in both equation no need to multiply with any number
Add both the equations.
So, we get
(1+_{i}_)x + (_{j}_-_{j}_)y = _{l}_+_{k}_
i.e.,_{{i+1}}_x = _{{l+k}}_
i.e.,x = \(_{{l+k}}_\over _{{i+1}}_\)
Now, Substitute the value of x in equation 1.
We get
\(_{{l+k}}_\over _{{i+1}}_\) + _{j}_y = _{k}_
_{j}_y = _{k}_-\(_{{l+k}}_\over _{{i+1}}_\)
_{j}_y = \({_{{k*(i+1)}}_-_{{l+k}}_}\over _{{i+1}}_\)
y = \({_{{k*(i+1)-(l+k)}}_}\over _{{j*(i+1)}}_\)
So, the solution required is:
x = \(_{{l+k}}_\over _{{i+1}}_\) and y = \({_{{k*(i+1)-(l+k)}}_}\over _{{j*(i+1)}}_\)

content.text:
Solve the following equation by the elimination method.
x + _{j}_y = _{k}_ and _{i}_x - _{j}_y = _{l}_
